ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 11 Aug 1999, Chas Watkins wrote:

> Thanks for that, but now I'm really confused. I must of misunderstood LORE
> items. I know you can have only one but I thought that made them no drop no
> trade. Can anyone please explain why an item, other than the newbie stuff
> and our summoned hammers might be No Drop. Or if they know of one.

Heh - that's a damned good question! =)

Ostensibly, the reason there are certain NoTrade/NoDrop items is to
prevent farming items out - either through camping or through having
higher level characters obtain quest items for you (for instance,
crafted armor, the Brewer's Compendium, et alia). I don't agree with
the philosophy, but it is something Verant sees as a solution.

Lore Items are just to make sure that people don't go around
dual-wielding the PGT.

--
We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us,
with nothing to show for our progress but the memory of the smell
of smoke and the presumption that once our eyes watered.
